column3: +1 to users not seeing the term "conflicted" when such is not the case.  I don't know what else was considered but tracking a persistent seen-the-network status and showing "Not shared" or similar seems a good way to do this.\n

@dgenr8 I think it was never the plan to leave it that way forever... In any case, the more complete and correct way to handle that is to change the conflict logic from checking if the txn is in the mempool already to checking if the it would be accepted into the mempool if it were tried; but thats a fair bit of work for what is otherwise a small feature, so it's not great to have to do it first.\
This functionality is already useful, temporarily showing the transaction as conflicted is arguably a small issue. Not saying it doesn't deserve to be fixed, but it could be done later.\n
@laanwj getrawtransaction needs to check the wallet. :) (otherwise there is no way to getrawtransaction on a transaction you just created via the wallet)\n
utACK.\nI think a rpc test who covers this feature would be nice. I'll write once during this or next week.\n
@jonasschnelli it doesn't actually work right now for the reason I described.\n

It does actually work right now. I've tested it.

As said in the opening post you can get the transaction hex using `gettransaction`. Using `getrawtransaction` won't work, as it doesn't (and should not!) query the wallet.
::facepalm::  I had completely forgotten about the existence of gettransaction and on account read that as getrawtransaction.\n
rebased and squashed to pull in @jonasschnelli 's RPC test, thanks!\n
